name: CIEL terminology
aliases: Columbia International eHealth Lab concept dictionary
description: CIEL terminology is an open source clinical interface terminology mapped to multiple standard code systems such as ICD, SNOMED CT, LOINC, RxNORM that ensures health information systems can collect, normalize and analyze/report high quality health information.

sdgs.relevance: CIEL is primarily designed to help with the assessment of health problems, the implementation of health interventions and evaluation of health indicators (therefore most closely associated with SDG3). CIEL is also designed to empower communities and underserved areas by ensuring that the information systems are sensitive to their needs. Its multi-lingual, multi-national data dictionary allows for sharing of best practices and data to improve representation of LMICs and underrepresented populations in national reporting, research and care delivery.

openStandards: CIEL terminology itself is designed to facilitate the use of international terminology standards such as the International Classification of Diseases
other WHO classifications. It provides the content in a FHIR-compatible API in addition to JSON and CSV.
